Sentencas: Composites of 6 mol% scandia-stabilized zirconia materials (6ScSZ) and nanosize Al2O3 powder (0-30wt.%) were prepared and characterized for electrical conductivity by the ac impedance method at various temperatures ranging from 300 to 950 degrees C.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity enhancement in heterogeneously doped scandia-stabilized zirconia

Sentencas: All the composites characterized showed improved conductivity at higher temperatures compared to the undoped ScSZ.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity enhancement in heterogeneously doped scandia-stabilized zirconia

Sentencas: An average conductivity of 0.12 S cm(-1) was measured at 850 degrees C for 6ScSZ+30 wt.% Al2O3 Composite samples, an increase in conductivity up to 20% compared to the undoped 6ScSZ specimen at this temperature.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity enhancement in heterogeneously doped scandia-stabilized zirconia

Sentencas: Microstructural evaluation using scanning electron microscopy revealed that the ScSZ grain size was relatively unchanged up to 10 wt.% of Al2O3 additions.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity enhancement in heterogeneously doped scandia-stabilized zirconia

Sentencas: However, the grain size was reduced in samples with higher (20 and 30 wt.%) additions of Al2O3.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity enhancement in heterogeneously doped scandia-stabilized zirconia

Sentencas: Small grain size, reduced quantity of the 6ScSZ material (only 70%), and improved conductivity makes these ScSZ+30wt.% Al2O3 composites very attractive as electrolyte materials in view of their collective mechanical and electrical properties and cost requirements.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity enhancement in heterogeneously doped scandia-stabilized zirconia

Sentencas: The observed increase in conductivity values with the additions of an insulating Al2O3 phase is explained in light of the space charge regions at the 6ScSZ-Al2O3 grain boundaries.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity enhancement in heterogeneously doped scandia-stabilized zirconia
Electrical conductivity enhancement in heterogeneously doped scandia-stabilized zirconia
Electrical conductivity enhancement in heterogeneously doped scandia-stabilized zirconia
